item.title: Docker Volume Mounting: Permissions and Ownership Explained
item.description: There are two ways to mount volumes in Docker: Hostpath: docker run -it --rm -v $PWD/myvol:/app ubuntu Volume: docker volume create myvol docker run -it --rm -v myvol:/app ubuntu When dealing with volume ownership, incorrect folder ownership can cause the container to crash, requiring time to debug logs.
